meanings.definition: Growing inward or into a part of the body
meanings.sent1: The ingrowing toenail caused him pain.
meanings.sent2: She had an ingrowing hair on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowing plant seemed to be exploring her skin.
meanings.sent4: His ingrowing thoughts consumed his mind.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowing vine wrapped around the tree tightly.

meanings.definition: Developing within or penetrating into something
meanings.sent1: The ingrowing roots of the tree spread far.
meanings.sent2: The ingrowing mold was hard to remove.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowing idea took root in his mind.
meanings.sent4: Her ingrowing curiosity led her to new discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowing stain seeped into the fabric.

meanings.definition: Tending to grow inward or into something
meanings.sent1: The ingrowing tendency of the ivy made it hard to control.
meanings.sent2: His ingrowing habit of overthinking caused anxiety.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowing pattern of behavior puzzled her friends.
meanings.sent4: The ingrowing desire for knowledge drove her to study harder.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowing fear of failure held him back from trying new things.
